article.headline: Binghamton 72, VMI 63
article.story: FAIRBANKS, Alaska (AP) -- Sebastian Hermenier had 19 points and six rebounds and Binghamton defeated VMI 72-63 Sunday for seventh place in the BP Top of the World Classic. Binghamton (1-2) never trailed, and took a 15-5 lead on a jump shot by Dariel Lucas with 13:13 remaining in the first half. VMI (0-3) whittled away at the lead, and a 3-pointer by Fred Robinson tied it at 25-all with 5:28 remaining left. But Binghamton led 32-31 at halftime. Two baskets apiece by Hermenier and Nick Billings in a 9-2 run starting the second half pushed the lead to 43-33. Radee Skipworth completed a three-point play and closed the gap to 55-50 with 8:33 remaining but VMI could get no closer. Nick Billings had 12 points and eight rebounds for Binghamton before leaving with an ankle injury with 5:13 left.
